subject: Nutrition
title: Aquaponics and Hydroponics
description: A quick, practical guide to Aquaponics and Hydroponics.

hook.text: In aquaponics, fish waste feeds plants and plants clean the water for fish. It's a closed-loop food factory.

buildup.text: Hydroponics grows plants in nutrient-rich water without soil. Roots absorb what they need directly.

discovery.text: Hydroponic lettuce grows 30% faster than soil-grown lettuce and uses 90% less water.

twist.text: Critics note these systems trade soil problems for energy dependency and manufactured nutrient costs.

climax.text: In deserts and cities where soil is scarce, soilless farming may be the only viable food production method.

punchline.text: Growing food without soil is already feeding millions.

quiz.question: How much faster does hydroponic lettuce grow?
